metadata.title: CVE-2023-23603 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: Regular expressions used to filter out forbidden properties and values fromstyle directives in calls to console.log weren't accountingfor external URLs. Data could then be potentially exfiltrated from thebrowser. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 109, Thunderbird < 102.7, andFirefox ESR < 102.7. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23603` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
